items.title: VI Live: Van de Ven draagt aanvoerdersband bij Spurs
items.summary: Goedendag en welkom in de VI Live van zondag 28 december! De laatste zondag van 2025 zit vol met leuke wedstrijden, en in dit liveblog hoeft u niks te missen.

items.title: Excelsior zwaait Booth uit, NEC neemt definitief afscheid van Larsen
items.summary: We zitten in het intermezzo tussen de zomer- en winterwindow, toch druppelt er in het najaar vaak nog een aantal transfers binnen. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Fitte Hakimi zorgt voor vreugde bij Marokko-bondscoach: 'Laat me PSG bedanken'
items.summary: Marokko kan tijdens het laatste groepsduel van de Afrika Cup weer een beroep doen op Achraf Hakimi. De verdediger is hersteld van een enkelblessure, tot grote vreugde bij bondscoach Walid Regragui. De fitheid van Hakimi is volgens hem te danken aan zijn werkgever bij Paris Saint-Germain.

items.title: Teahupoo sweeps to Christmas Hurdle success
items.summary: Teahupoo stamped his authority on the staying division with a dominant performance in the Grade One Christmas Hurdle at Leopardstown.

items.title: Aubameyang en Gabon moeten vrezen voor vroegtijdige uitschakeling op Afrika Cup
items.summary: Gabon lijkt al in de eerste ronde van de Afrika Cup te stranden. Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang heeft met zijn land een wonder nodig om als een van de beste nummers drie te tweede ronde te bereiken.

items.title: Serie A roundup: Christopher Nkunku at the double to send Milan to summit
items.summary: Forward scores twice in 3-0 win over Verona Inter can return to top on Sunday evening Milan beat Hellas Verona 3-0 on Sunday to leapfrog leaders Inter and provisionally move top of the Serie A standings thanks to a brace from Christopher Nkunku. Milan struggled to break down a disciplined Verona side in the first half but made the breakthrough from a corner in added time when Christian Pulisic volleyed home near the far post. This story will be updated Continue reading...

items.title: Van Dijk: More to come from Wirtz for Liverpool
items.summary: Virgil van Dijk has heaped praise on teammate Florian Wirtz and backed him to continue delivering for Liverpool after he scored his first goal for the club in Saturday's 2-1 victory over Wolverhampton Wanderers.

items.title: √òdegaard: Rice has put Arsenal in charge again
items.summary: Martin Odegaard believes Declan Rice's "unbelievable" performance as an emergency right-back demonstrates that Arsenal are "ready to do whatever it takes" to win the Premier League.

items.title: James: Only Chelsea to blame for Villa collapse
items.summary: Captain Reece James feels Chelsea have themselves to blame after throwing away a half-time lead to lose 2-1 to Aston Villa.

items.title: Jorge Jesus en Cristiano Ronaldo breken record met Al Nassr
items.summary: Voor het eerst in de geschiedenis van het Saoedische profvoetbal heeft een club tien competitiewedstrijden op rij een gewonnen vanaf de start. Al Nassr kreeg het zaterdag voor elkaar, mede dankzij twee doelpunten van Cristiano Ronaldo.

items.title: What was better? Xhaka‚Äôs assist or Adingra‚Äôs finish?!
items.summary: Sunderland go ahead against Leeds, courtesy of a superb goal from Simon Adingra.

items.title: Eriksen: Amorim's United criticism 'did not help'
items.summary: Former Manchester United midfielder Christian Eriksen has criticised manager Ruben Amorim for claiming last year's side was the "worst" in the club's history.

items.title: Andy Carroll to appear in court after arrest and charge for breaching order
items.summary: Carroll charged with breaching non-molestation order Former England striker due in court on Tuesday The former England striker Andy Carroll has been charged with breaching a non-molestation order and is set to appear in court on Tuesday. Carroll, who was capped nine times by England and played for Newcastle and Liverpool, was arrested in April after allegedly committing an offence the previous month. Continue reading...

items.title: Liverpool set-piece problems a 'killer' - Van Dijk
items.summary: Virgil van Dijk says that Liverpool's problems from set-pieces "hurts" and that the second phase is a "killer" for them.

items.title: Root: 'Silly' to change England management after Ashes defeat
items.summary: Joe Root says it would be "silly" for England to change their management team after the Ashes defeat and insists the players are "absolutely committed" to the current set-up.

items.title: Chelsea investigate after bottle thrown at Villa bench
items.summary: Chelsea will look into an incident after a plastic bottle containing what looked like water was thrown at Aston Villa's staff and players.

items.title: World Darts Championship LIVE! Anderson leading Wattimena in blistering contest
Ex-England striker Carroll due in court after arrest
items.summary: Former Newcastle United, Liverpool and England forward Andy Carroll is due to appear in court on Tuesday after he was charged with breaching a non-molestation order.

items.title: Ian Darke's Premier League Best XI: Who stands out halfway through the season?
items.summary: Will it be Donnarumma or Raya for best goalkeeper? Which two Sunderland players are in? Here are the season's top players as we near the halfway point.
